Edibles.bio: Edibles can be a great way to ensure you're getting precise dosage. You need to make sure what you're consuming has been created with this precision, and maintain awareness of how much you consume over given periods of time.
Edibles.strains: If you prefer cannabis' therapeutic effects -- calming, pain management, anti-anxiety -- more than its heady, trippy aspects, you have options with edibles created with precision dosage in mind.

Vaping.bio: Vaporizing cannabis can allow for accurate dosing; it's up to products to measure & communicate dosage accurately, and up to you to ensure proper dosage.
Vaping.strains: Vaping also helps avoid harmful carcinogens while enjoy subtle cannabinoid and terpene profiles

Smoking.bio: Smoking gives you a wide variety of product options, but it's a difficult way to control your dose.
Smoking.strains: A low-dose is considered 1 - 5mg of THC; A single toke of a joint can contain more than 10 millligrams of THC.

Topicals.bio: Topicals are a good way to release medicine into your system slowly over time. Precision regarding the amount of product to use, the timing, and application areas all factor into dosage you'll receive.
Topicals.strains: Topicals like sprays, lotions, and creams can help with area-specific pain and inflammation.
Topicals.sponsorTagline: Mondo is an all-natural powder made from Blue Dream flowers

Dabbing.bio: Dabbing is not recommended as an effective means of precise low dosages.
Dabbing.strains: Anecdotal and medical studies have suggested microdosing helps with Chronic Pain, Migraines, Inflammation, Anxiety, Stress, Depression.
